==APT repository for D==

==="d-apt" is an ATP repository to easily install/upgrade D binary packages on systems like Debian, Ubuntu, Linux Mint, etc.===


to enable it, add repository sources:

<code language="xml">$ sudo wget -O /etc/apt/sources.list.d/d-apt.list https://d-apt.googlecode.com/files/sources.list</code>

then update local info and import d-apt public key:

<code language="xml">$ sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get --yes --allow-unauthenticated install d-apt-keyring && sudo apt-get update</code>

To install packages: (i.e. GtkD library and documentation)

<code language="xml">$ sudo apt-get install libgtkd-dev libgtkd-doc</code>

----

Debianized source packages not available.

----

Every dev package contains a "pkg-config" configuration file for the specific library.

i.e., to compile "Plot2kill" applications:

<code language="xml">$ dmd ``pkg-config --cflags --libs plot2kill`` my_plot2kill_app.d</code>

Almost all dev packages contains both 32-bit and 64-bit static libraries.

i.e., to compile 64-bit "Tango" applications on a 32-bit system:

<code language="xml">$ dmd ``pkg-config --cflags --libs tango`` -m64 my_tango_app.d</code>

All doc packages contains the library ddoc generated with candydoc, and a system menu entry. Also contains examples if any.
